Description: Rim sherd of Chian Mature Animal Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed streaky black below; part of two worn rosettes in white outline with red centres; below, two white bands; top of rim glazed; exterior: broken maeander band between bands at rim; below, painted decoration consisting of part of sphinx tail and part of head of sphinx, both to left; pendant triangle and lozenge as filling ornament.
Curator's comments: Lemos describes the sherd as belonging to the Group of Light-Walled Naukratis Animal Chalices. All sherds in this group are small and offer very little by way of information beyond the fact that they come from light-walled chalices. The decoration on sherds belonging to this group is also poorly or carelessly drawn (Lemos 1991, 981). For parallels regarding interior and exterior decoration, see British Museum 1924,1201.580. See also British Museum 1924,1201.255, 1924,1201.259 and Louvre AM1362 (1).
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 93, p. 259, no. 491, pl. 65)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0499) (phase 2)
